cards.name: Cataclysmic Gearhulk
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Cataclysmic Gearhulk enters the battlefield, each player chooses an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a planeswalker from among the nonland permanents he or she controls, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.name: Torrential Gearhulk
cards.text:
Flash
When Torrential Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may cast target instant card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Noxious Gearhulk
cards.text:
Menace
When Noxious Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may destroy another target creature. If a creature is destroyed this way, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Combustible Gearhulk
cards.text:
First strike
When Combustible Gearhulk enters the battlefield, target opponent may have you draw three cards. If the player doesn't, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard, then Combustible Gearhulk deals damage to that player equal to the total converted mana cost of those cards.

cards.name: Verdurous Gearhulk
cards.text:
Trample
When Verdurous Gearhulk enters the battlefield, distribute four +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures you control.

cards.name: Aether Vial
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on Aether Vial.
{T}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Aether Vial from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Adi Thandray designed this helm as a tribute to his mentor, the great Daljit Gavaskar.
cards.name: Champion's Helm

cards.flavor: It exemplifies the motto of the Luminary League: "Innovation requires insatiable curiosity and a good source of light."
cards.name: Chromatic Lantern
cards.text:
Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Chrome Mox
cards.text:
Imprint — When Chrome Mox enters the battlefield, you may exile a nonartifact, nonland card from your hand.
{T}: Add one mana of any of the exiled card's colors to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: With innovative stabilizing techniques, Suja Pavani brings this piece of the sky itself to the Inventors' Fair.
cards.name: Cloudstone Curio
cards.text: Whenever a nonartifact permanent enters the battlefield under your control, you may return another permanent you control that shares a permanent type with it to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: By isolating liquid aether at room temperature, foundry hand Jitya Reyath has given us a glimpse of raw aetheric matter—the very stuff of the cosmos.
cards.name: Crucible of Worlds
cards.text: You may play land cards from your graveyard.

cards.name: Gauntlet of Power
cards.text:
As Gauntlet of Power enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures of the chosen color get +1/+1.
Whenever a basic land is tapped for mana of the chosen color, its controller adds one mana of that color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Hangarback Walker
cards.text:
Hangarback Walker enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
When Hangarback Walker dies, create a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying for each +1/+1 counter on Hangarback Walker.
{1}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Hangarback Walker.

cards.flavor: This matched set incorporates aetheric accelerators and deflection matrices in an elegant, wearable design.
cards.name: Lightning Greaves
cards.text:
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}

cards.flavor: Each of these intricate mechanical petals stores enough power to supply all of Ghirapur, if only for a fleeting moment.
cards.name: Lotus Petal
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Petal: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: An utterly silent chamber, submitted by an artificer who wished to remain anonymous.
cards.name: Mana Crypt
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Developed and tested by researchers at the Consulate's House of Knowledge, these devices allow anyone to see with a visionary's eye.
cards.name: Mind's Eye
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: On loan from a private collection, this unique mechanism extracts power from a carefully prepared gemstone.
cards.name: Mox Opal
cards.text: Metalcraft — {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control three or more artifacts.

cards.flavor: This whimsical automaton helps create beautiful murals, then stands guard as they dry.
cards.name: Painter's Servant
cards.text:
As Painter's Servant enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are the chosen color in addition to their other colors.

cards.flavor: Crafted in emulation of dwarven hearth decorations, these devices doubled the output of Amrit Vatyam's forges.
cards.name: Rings of Brighthearth
cards.text: Whenever you activate an ability, if it isn't a mana ability, you may pay {2}. If you do, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Scroll Rack
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Exile any number of cards from your hand face down. Put that many cards from the top of your library into your hand. Then look at the exiled cards and put them on top of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: Perfected by the kinetic sculptor Shanti Makam, these self-assembling metal strands can be coaxed into any shape imaginable.
cards.name: Sculpting Steel
cards.text: You may have Sculpting Steel enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: It took the reclusive Venya Sangmi a lifetime to realize her childhood vision: a band of sunlight made solid.
cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Solemn Simulacrum
cards.text:
When Solemn Simulacrum enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
When Solemn Simulacrum dies, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: Reduction of energy and motion within the stasis field creates the illusion of slowed time.
cards.name: Static Orb
cards.text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.

cards.flavor: In an unusual foray into the humanoid form, Venand Kapur—known as the Gearherder—built this automaton to keep watch over his clockwork herds.
cards.name: Steel Overseer
cards.text: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each artifact creature you control.

cards.name: Sword of Feast and Famine
Sword of Fire and Ice
Sword of Light and Shadow

cards.flavor:
"Top-performing automaton combatants are to be seized and modified for service."
—Confiscation directive
cards.name: Arcbound Ravager
cards.text:
Sacrifice an artifact: Put a +1/+1 counter on Arcbound Ravager.
Modular 1 (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, you may put its +1/+1 counters on target artifact creature.)

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in his or her hand minus 4.

cards.name: Chalice of the Void
cards.text:
Chalice of the Void enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Chalice of the Void, counter that spell.

cards.flavor:
"Woven together, strands of aether can form a mesh of surprising stability, though such a network tends to pull power from nearby devices."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.

cards.name: Duplicant
cards.text:
Imprint — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
As long as a card exiled with Duplicant is a creature card, Duplicant has the power, toughness, and creature types of the last creature card exiled with Duplicant. It's still a Shapeshifter.

cards.name: Engineered Explosives
cards.text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
{2}, Sacrifice Engineered Explosives: Destroy each nonland permanent with converted mana cost equal to the number of charge counters on Engineered Explosives.

cards.flavor:
"With a few minor adjustments, we were able to convert sky-dock assisters into a defense system for the Aether Spire."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Ensnaring Bridge
cards.text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.

cards.name: Extraplanar Lens
cards.text:
Imprint — When Extraplanar Lens enters the battlefield, you may exile target land you control.
Whenever a land with the same name as the exiled card is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.flavor:
"All attempts to halt the machine failed. We must find a way to repurpose it."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Grindstone
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If both cards share a color, repeat this process.

cards.flavor:
"When it oscillated above a particular frequency, the stone induced acute listlessness in several researchers."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Meekstone
cards.text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Oblivion Stone
cards.text:
{4}, {T}: Put a fate counter on target permanent.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Oblivion Stone: Destroy each nonland permanent without a fate counter on it, then remove all fate counters from all permanents.

cards.flavor:
"Consider all confiscated items hostile until proven otherwise."
—Confiscation directive
cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"This device was submitted to the Fair anonymously. It is imperative that its maker be found. We must understand it."
—Confiscation directive
cards.name: Paradox Engine
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, untap all nonland permanents you control.

cards.name: Pithing Needle
cards.text:
As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, name a card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

cards.flavor:
"Rashmi's design was just the beginning. We are most eager to see what the High Consul has planned for it."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Planar Bridge
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Search your library for a permanent card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Adi Thandray's angel is a Priority One confiscation from the Fair. Once you see it, you'll understand why."
—Confiscation directive
cards.name: Platinum Angel
cards.text:
Flying
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.

cards.flavor:
"At the outset, we weren't aware of Chief Baral's motives for the project. It's now apparent that he intends to use the device to hamper the ‘mages' among the ranks of the renegades."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Sphere of Resistance
cards.text: Spells cost {1} more to cast.

cards.name: Staff of Domination
cards.text:
{1}: Untap Staff of Domination.
{2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
{3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
{4}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{5}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"Truth be told, my team had hoped never to see the day it was deployed."
—Consulate engineer's log
cards.name: Sundering Titan
cards.text: When Sundering Titan enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, choose a land of each basic land type, then destroy those lands.

cards.name: Sword of Body and Mind
Sword of War and Peace

cards.flavor:
"This exhibition of Nehra's Threshold Principle must be expropriated and examined for its potential applications in enforcement."
—Confiscation directive
cards.name: Trinisphere
cards.text: As long as Trinisphere is untapped, each spell that would cost less than three mana to cast costs three mana to cast. (Additional mana in the cost may be paid with any color of mana or colorless mana. For example, a spell that would cost {1}{B} to cast costs {2}{B} to cast instead.)

cards.name: Vedalken Shackles
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Vedalken Shackles during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of Islands you control for as long as Vedalken Shackles remains tapped.

cards.name: Wurmcoil Engine
cards.text:
Deathtouch, lifelink
When Wurmcoil Engine dies, create a 3/3 colorless Wurm artifact creature token with deathtouch and a 3/3 colorless Wurm artifact creature token with lifelink.
